    "554","37570",", PP. 94 , 96","31017",", PP. 94 , 96","C:\Messages\HUID\Biological Chronology 1990-97.txt" Does not work. Produces :concept_ PP. 94 a :Concept; :mentioned_in :document_554; rdfs:label " 96" .

      • doReader

        public static java.util.Collection<CSVRecord> doReader(java.io.BufferedReader reader,
                                       boolean stripQuotes,
                                       int headerLine)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        Parameters:
        reader -
        stripQuotes -
        headerLine - - -1: there is no header; make surrogate headers // TODO: change to just header line number 1 based. 1: do not delay parsing the header (it is first) 2: the first line does not contain the header, it is on the 2nd line. 3: the first 2 lines do not contain the header, it is on the 3rd line.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • visitRecords

        public static void visitRecords(java.io.BufferedReader reader,
                boolean stripQuotes,
                java.lang.Integer headerLine,
                java.lang.Integer dataStartRow,
                java.lang.Integer dataEndRow,
                RowHandler visitor)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. - replaced by #visitRecords(BufferedReader, char, Integer, Set, Integer, Integer, RowHandler) b/c it uses http://javacsv.sourceforge.net/
        visitRecords using custom parser. Has but where values end in commas: ,"My Company, Inc.,",
        Parameters:
        reader -
        stripQuotes -
        headerLine - - -1: there is no header; make surrogate headers // TODO: change to just header line number 1 based. 1: do not delay parsing the header (it is first) 2: the first line does not contain the header, it is on the 2nd line. 3: the first 2 lines do not contain the header, it is on the 3rd line.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • visitRecords

        public static void visitRecords(java.io.InputStream csvStream,
                char delimiter,
                boolean expectLargeValues,
                java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                java.lang.Integer headerRow,
                java.util.Set<java.lang.Long> headerRowDisplacements,
                java.lang.Integer dataStartRow,
                java.lang.Integer dataEndRow,
                java.lang.Integer sampleLimit,
                RowHandler visitor)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        visitRecords using CSV parser from http://javacsv.sourceforge.net/ see https://github.com/timrdf/csv2rdf4lod-automation/wiki/conversion:HeaderRow
        Parameters:
        bufferedReader - - where to read table from.
        delimiter - - between cell values.
        expectLargeValues - -
        headerRow - - one based row number for where headers are.
        headerRowDisplacements - - set of integer displacements from 'headerRow' that also contain header info.
        dataStartRow - - one based "the first (inclusive) row that contains data."
        dataEndRow - - one based "the last (inclusive) row that contains data."
        sampleSize - -
        visitor - - who to give the row record to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
